oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Music & the Spoken Word - Mormon Tabernacle Choir radio program - Episode 750 Part 1 - 1943-12-05 - KSL - WLAC
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Syndicated radio broadcast of the Music & the Spoken Word radio program, originally broadcast from KSL (Salt Lake City, Utah). Recorded from Temple Square in Salt Lake City, Utah, the program is narrated by Richard L. Evans, conducted by J. Spencer Cornwall, and performed by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir with Frank W. Asper on organ. This is the first part of the 750th airing, recorded on December 5, 1943. Part two: TR004029_2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Frank W. Asper
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs the opening theme / (0:48) Richard L. Evans announces the opening statements / (1:25) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "Lead Kindly Light" / (4:06) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (4:17) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs the 23rd Psalm in hymnal format / (5:34) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (5:45) Frank W. Asper performs a religious march, composed by Alexandre Guilmant / (10:49) Richard L. Evans reads a scripture passage and introduces the next performance / (11:28) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "How Firm A Foundation" set to the music of Adeste Fideles / (13:24) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (13:37) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "Guide Us Thou Great Jehovah," composed by John Hughes / (15:23) Richard L. Evans reads a scripture passage [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Music and the spoken word (Radio program); KSL (Radio station : Salt Lake City, Utah); WLAC (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.)
